name: Bartholomew Roberts
description: Bartholomew Roberts, or Black Bart, was a feared 18th-century pirate captain known for his strategic brilliance, capturing over 400 ships during the Golden Age of Piracy.

name: Edward Teach
description: Blackbeard, the infamous pirate of the Golden Age of Piracy, was known for his menacing appearance, with a black beard adorned with slow-burning fuses, and a reputation for ruthless plundering and terrorizing the high seas in the early 18th century.

name: Captain Morgan
description: Captain Morgan, a legendary 17th-century privateer turned pirate, is celebrated for his swashbuckling adventures and association with the famous spiced rum brand that bears his name.

name: Benjamin Horningold
description: Captain Benjamin Hornigold, an early 18th-century pirate, was notorious for his ever-changing allegiances and later, his pardon-seeking efforts in the Caribbean, a complex figure in pirate history.

name: Jack Rackham
description: Calico Jack, aka John Rackham, was an 18th-century pirate known for his distinctive attire, including calico clothing. He sailed with infamous female pirates Anne Bonny and Mary Read.
